title: Golf: Shot Checker
instructions:
You're on the golf course and the golfer has hit the ball. Your job is to roll the ball and check if it lands in the hole!

You have three functions:
- `rollTo(x, y)` rolls the ball to position (x, y)
- `getShotLength()` returns how far the golfer hit the ball
- `fireFireworks()` celebrates the shot

The ball starts at x=29, y=75. Get the shot length, then roll the ball right one step at a time (shotLength + 1 steps). If the shot length is between 56 and 65 (inclusive), the ball is over the hole â€” roll it down 9 units to sink it. Then fire the fireworks!
hints: Start by storing the shot length in a variable, e.g. let shotLength = getShotLength()
Use a loop to roll the ball right, updating x each time
Check if shotLength >= 56 and shotLength <= 65 to see if it's over the hole
If the ball is over the hole, roll it down 9 times by updating y
